questions.question: What was the order sequence of human migration across the planet?

choices.answer: Pac. Islands, Americas, Europe, Australia, Eurasia, Africa
Africa, Europe, Eurasia, Americas, Pac. Islands, Australia
Africa, Eurasia, Australia, Europe, Americas, Pac. Islands

questions.question: How did Austronesian migrations differ from other early patterns of human movement?

choices.answer: They carried plants and animals in canoes
They adopted a completely new culture upon arrival
They adapted to their environment with new technologies

questions.question: In what ways did a gathering and hunting economy shape other aspects of Paleolithic societies?

choices.answer: They were egalitarian with no need of private property
They all practiced the same religious beliefs
They all began to use animal skins as currency

questions.question: Why did some Paleolithic peoples abandon nomadic ways and begin to live a more settled life?

choices.answer: Climatic warming which led to increased food stocks
They adopted animal husbandry, drifting between pastures
Because the Qin dynasty started to build the Great Wall

questions.question: What accounts for the emergence of agriculture after countless millennia of human life w/o it?

choices.answer: Global-Warming, Animal Extinction, Technology, Larger Pops.
Aliens came to earth and showed humans how to farm
The Sumerians spread agriculture to the other 1st Civs.
When fire was discovered, humans cleared space to grow crops

questions.question: In what ways did agriculture spread?

choices.answer: The Egyptians shared their knowledge across the globe
It didn't. The Bantu kept their agriculture knowledge secret

questions.question: Why was agriculture sometimes resisted?

choices.answer: The region was unsuitable for farming or it wasn't needed
Pastoralism was more practical in certain places
Groups believed it was against the will of the gods

questions.question: What different kinds of societies emerged out of the Agricultural Revolution?

choices.answer: Pastoral Societies, Village Based Ag. Societies, & Chiefdoms

questions.question: Where did the first civilizations emerge?

choices.answer: Mesopotamia, Nile River, S. America, & Central Eurasia
Egypt, as well as, North & South America

questions.question: What distinguished "civilizations" from earlier Paleolithic and Neolithic societies?

choices.answer: Civilizations had larger populations and greater inequality
Nothing, it's just a term to describe the new societies
They were the same size, but began to farm
There was more leisure time than seen in the Paleolithic era

questions.question: Which Cradle civ. is credited with developing the first written language?
What most accounts for the initial breakthroughs to civilization?
What was the role of cities in the early civilizations?

choices.answer: Cities did not exist in Paleolithic times

questions.question: Which is NOT a way social inequality was expressed in early civilizations?
In what ways have historians tried to explain the origins of patriarchy?

choices.answer: New agriculture methods, military conflict, private property
Hunter gatherers felt men's hunting was more important

questions.question: How did Mesopotamian and Egyptian patriarchy differ from each other?

choices.answer: Mesop.=Strict written laws; Egy.=More opportunity for women
Egy.=Strict written laws; Mesop.=More opportunity for women

questions.question: How did govs. keep power in the First Civilizations?
In what ways did Mesopotamian and Egyptian civilizations differ from each other?

choices.answer: Egypt was more city-based and Mesopotamia was more ag.-based
Mesopotamia was more city-based and Egypt was more ag.-based
Only Egypt built monumental spiritual structures

questions.question: Which is NOT a way Mesopotamian & Egyptian civs were shaped by interactions w/neighbors?
Who first acquires The Ring from Gollum after a match of riddles?
